column4: apt-cache search, apt-file search, most of the time the packages are in lib$something format.  You're probably looking for zlibc, or if you're compiling something: zlib1g-dev
Thanks - searching for libz or zlib gives hundreds of options so i just did this : apt-cache search libz | awk '{print "apt-get install " $1} | /bin/sh
Er. I wouldn't do that if I were you.  Often packages will replace one another, and you could put your system in an unusable state doing so.
: Just figured at least one of those should include the lib ;-)
